intro: Chalcas crenulata, commonly known as the smoothleaf chalcas, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to certain regions of Central America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is often found in forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
